title: Forces - Modified Atwood machine with two surfaces

content.description: Which of the following correctly compares the coefficient of kinetic friction <math alttext="mu" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>μ</mi></mstyle></math> between Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and the two materials and describes the change in the magnitude of the sum of forces on Block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, <math alttext="the sum of F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Σ</mi><mi>F</mi></mstyle></math>, as Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> slides from Material <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> to Material <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>?
content.question: Coefficients <math alttext="the sum of F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Σ</mi><mi>F</mi></mstyle></math> on Block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> A <math alttext="mu sub A is greater than mu sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> Decreases B <math alttext="mu sub A is greater than mu sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> Increases C <math alttext="mu sub A is less than mu sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> Increases D <math alttext="mu sub A is less than mu sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> Decreases

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
